adempiereAD.Name: REPORTING_ORG
adempiereAD.Description: Reporting Organization for Tax Report & WHTax Report
adempiereAD.creator: pasuwatw@gmail.com

window.Help: The Organization Window allows you to define and maintain Organizational entities. An Organization is often a legal entity or sub-unit for which documents and transactions are processed
window.Name: Organization

element.Help: An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.
element.Name: Organization

dynvalrule.Name: AD_Org Security validation
dynvalrule.Description: Not Summary - 0 - Organizations of the Client with user acces rights

element.Help: A Client is a company or a legal entity. You cannot share data between Clients. Tenant is a synonym for Client.
element.Name: Client

column.Help: A Client is a company or a legal entity. You cannot share data between Clients. Tenant is a synonym for Client.
column.Name: Client

element.Description: The record is active in the system
element.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
element.Name: Active

column.Description: The record is active in the system
column.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
column.Name: Active

element.Description: Search key for the record in the format required - must be unique
element.Help: A search key allows you a fast method of finding a particular record. If you leave the search key empty, the system automatically creates a numeric number. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
element.Name: Search Key

column.Description: Search key for the record in the format required - must be unique
column.Help: A search key allows you a fast method of finding a particular record. If you leave the search key empty, the system automatically creates a numeric number. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
column.Name: Search Key

element.Help: A summary entity represents a branch in a tree rather than an end-node. Summary entities are used for reporting and do not have own values.
element.Name: Summary Level

column.Help: A summary entity represents a branch in a tree rather than an end-node. Summary entities are used for reporting and do not have own values.
column.Name: Summary Level

tab.Name: Organization
tab.CommitWarning: All not manually maintained Roles will automatically have access to the new Organziation. You need restart your application server for most changes made here to be effective.
tab.Help: The Organization Tab is used to define an Organization. Each Organization has a Key and Name and optionally a Description. When adding a new organization, you must re-login to be able to access the new organization.

field.Name: Organization
field.Help: An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.

field.Name: Client
field.Help: A Client is a company or a legal entity. You cannot share data between Clients. Tenant is a synonym for Client.

field.Name: Search Key
field.Description: Search key for the record in the format required - must be unique
field.Help: A search key allows you a fast method of finding a particular record. If you leave the search key empty, the system automatically creates a numeric number. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

field.Name: Name
field.Help: The name of an entity (record) is used as an default search option in addition to the search key. The name is up to 60 characters in length.

field.Name: Description
field.Description: Optional short description of the record
field.Help: A description is limited to 255 characters.

field.Name: Active
field.Description: The record is active in the system
field.Help: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

field.Name: Summary Level
field.Help: A summary entity represents a branch in a tree rather than an end-node. Summary entities are used for reporting and do not have own values.

field.Name: Replication Strategy
field.Help: The Data Replication Strategy determines what and how tables are replicated

element.Description: Supervisor for this user/organization - used for escalation and approval
element.Help: The Supervisor indicates who will be used for forwarding and escalating issues for this user - or for approvals.
element.Name: Supervisor

referencetable.WhereClause: EXISTS (SELECT * FROM C_BPartner bp WHERE AD_User.C_BPartner_ID=bp.C_BPartner_ID AND (bp.IsEmployee='Y' OR bp.IsSalesRep='Y'))

element.Help: The Calendar uniquely identifies an accounting calendar. Multiple calendars can be used. For example you may need a standard calendar that runs from Jan 1 to Dec 31 and a fiscal calendar that runs from July 1 to June 30.
